about.summary:
A tool and python library that helps when interfacing with Ansible directly
or as part of another system whether that be through a container image
interface, as a standalone tool, or as a Python module that can be
imported. The goal is to provide a stable and consistent interface
abstraction to Ansible.

commands: pytest test/unit --cov ansible_runner -vv -k "not (containerization or env_vars or prepare_env_sshkey or container_volmount or registry_auth_cleanup or prepare_env_directory_isolation_from_settings or multiline_blank_write)" --cov-report term-missing:skip-covered --no-cov-on-fail --cov-fail-under=54

about.summary:
A tool and python library that helps when interfacing with Ansible directly
or as part of another system whether that be through a container image
interface, as a standalone tool, or as a Python module that can be
imported. The goal is to provide a stable and consistent interface
abstraction to Ansible.

commands: pytest test/unit --cov ansible_runner -vv -k "not (containerization or env_vars or prepare_env_sshkey or container_volmount or registry_auth_cleanup or prepare_env_directory_isolation_from_settings or multiline_blank_write)" --cov-report term-missing:skip-covered --no-cov-on-fail --cov-fail-under=54

name: ansible-runner
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "2.3.4" %}

package:
  name: ansible-runner
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  - folder: dist
    url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/a/ansible-runner/ansible-runner-{{ version }}.tar.gz
    sha256: 79a1bd134d813c8ea3740599c6fd961a11425ce7757f2fd725cf56d6a1a7236c
  - folder: src
    url: https://github.com/ansible/ansible-runner/archive/{{ version }}.tar.gz
    sha256: 13381b3f21713c9a4b021415f5259fd462fceedef5750bb7b99974e3bd11d3e3

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: python
  script: cd dist && {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv
  entry_points:
    - ansible-runner = ansible_runner.__main__:main

requirements:
  host:
    - pip
    - python >=3.6
    - pbr
  run:
    - pexpect >=4.5
    - psutil
    - python >=3.6
    - python-daemon
    - pyyaml
    - six

{% set skips = [
  "containerization",
  "env_vars",
  "prepare_env_sshkey",
  "container_volmount",
  "registry_auth_cleanup",
  "prepare_env_directory_isolation_from_settings",
  "multiline_blank_write",
] %}

test:
  source_files:
    - src/test
  requires:
    # from /test/requirements.txt
    - ansible >=5.4.0,<5.5.0
    # TODO: unpin after https://github.com/conda-forge/ansible-feedstock/pull/93
    - ansible-core >=2.12.2,<2.13.0
    - pip
    - pytest
    - pytest-cov
    - pytest-timeout
    - pytest-mock
  imports:
    - ansible_runner
  commands:
    - python -m pip check
    - ansible-runner --version
    - ansible-runner --help
    - cd src
    - pytest test/unit --cov ansible_runner -vv -k "not ({{ ' or '.join(skips) }})" --cov-report term-missing:skip-covered --no-cov-on-fail --cov-fail-under=54

about:
  home: https://github.com/ansible/ansible-runner
  license: Apache-2.0
  license_family: Apache
  license_file: dist/LICENSE.md
  doc_url: https://ansible-runner.readthedocs.io
  doc_source_url: https://github.com/ansible/ansible-runner/tree/master/docs
  summary: |
    A tool and python library that helps when interfacing with Ansible directly
    or as part of another system whether that be through a container image
    interface, as a standalone tool, or as a Python module that can be
    imported. The goal is to provide a stable and consistent interface
    abstraction to Ansible.

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - bollwyvl
